Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of High-Dose Preoperative Glucocorticoids in Open Liver Resection

Participants.evidence: Patients scheduled for open liver resection were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either 10 mg/kg methylprednisolone (high dose) or 8 mg dexamethasone (standard dose)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine if a single high dose of preoperative glucocorticoid reduces complications

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the number of patients with complications in the postanaesthesia care unit (PACU), measured during the PACU stay

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using block randomisation with allocation concealment via sealed opaque envelopes

Blinding.evidence: All participants, trial personnel, and outcome assessors were blinded

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 174 patients were randomised (88 to high-dose, 86 to standard-dose)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Complications occurred in 51 patients (58%) in the high-dose group and 58 (67%) in the standard-dose group (risk ratio 0.86, 95% CI 0.68 to 1.08; P = 0.213)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events occurred in 48 patients (45%) in the high-dose group and 49 (43%) in the standard-dose group
